reviewText: Hands down one of the best action/thriller fast paced movie, with so many twists and turns it will have you on the edge of your seat guessing right until the end!  You will  this awesome Danish foreign movie.

Yet another well acted, well shot Danish film! Nikolaj Lie Kaas stars as young lawyer Jonas Bechmann searching for the truth behind the death of his lawyer father twelve months prior. Jonas is determined to prove that jailed crime boss Claes Kiehlert (Kim Bodnia Broen: Season 1 (DVD) (The Bridge) (The Tunnel) (2011) NON-USA FORMAT (Region 2) (Import)) is responsible and sets out to prove his guilt. Tuva Novotny plays Jonas's girlfriend Camilla who has become tired of the deterioration of their relationship since his father's death. Starting out playing a moaning child in the Swedish nightly soap Skilda Världar (Swedish version of Australia's Sons and Daughters) in the late 1990s, Novotny now seems to play the girlfrined role in Danish films such as No Time for Love (2009) ( Simon & Malou ) ( Ingen planer om krlighed ) [ NON-USA FORMAT, PAL, Reg. 2 Import - Denmark ] and Truth About Men ( Sandheden om mnd ) [ NON-USA FORMAT, PAL, Reg. 2 Import - Denmark ]). Novotny plays her part well and is equalled by the efforts of Laura Christensen (Aftermath (2004) ( Lad de sm brn ) ( After math ) [ NON-USA FORMAT, PAL, Reg. 2 Import - United Kingdom ]) as Louise, the girl Jonas meets one night setting out a chain of terror for Jonas. The next morning following their meeting Jonas discovers Louise dead. An ingenious film which kept me guessing until the end, Kandidaten is just over 90 minutes long. The time spent watching this flew by. Viewers of recent Danish drama acquisitions in the UK will recognise a few faces in this piece. Swedish actor David Dencik (Those Who Kill / Brotherhood) plays Michael, Jonas's drinking friend. Birgitte Hjort Srensen (Katrine - BORGEN: SEASON 1 / Julie - en kamp om krlighed) pops up briefly as Louise's friend. Henning Valin (soon to be seen as policeman Jesper Andersson in The Bridge) plays another policeman, and Iben Dorner (Sanne - Borgen / Benedicte - Those Who Kill) pops up as a legal assistant. Nikolaj Lie Kaas is currently filming for the upcoming third series of The Killing - Complete Season 1 - 5-DVD Box Set ( Forbrydelsen (Forbrytelsen) ) ( The Killing - Complete Season One ) [ NON-USA FORMAT, PAL, Reg. 2 Import - United Kingdom ]. If he is as good in that as he is in this, it will certainly be worth a watch! Kandidaten is entirely in Danish with English subtitles and is co-production involving Danish TV2 produced in 2008. Extras on the disc include brief introductions to each character (in English) with a trailer for the film and a short teaser. Enjoy!

A succesful young attorney is involved into a dark crime he didn't committ. As more he tries to find out the reasons of this blackmail, the more he gets close to a supposed car accident in which his father died. Soon, he will discover the unpleasant true behind stage.

Effective and solid thriller, well acted, well designed and well written. Don't miss it!!

"Kandidaten" ("The Candidate") is a 2008 Danish thriller about a young lawyer Jonas Bechmann (Nikolaj Lie Kaas "Angels & Demons"), whose father was killed in a car accident one year ago. Jonas still believes that the death of his father, a defense attorney for the feared crime lord, is really a murder, and Jonas is determined to investigate the "case" no matter what it takes, even though his relationship with his girlfriend Camilla (Tuva Novotny) gets strained.

Then one morning, after spending a night with a young woman Louise (Laura Christensen) Jonas met at the bar, he wakes up in a hotel room where he discovers the dead body of the woman. He doesn't remember what happened the night before. And he soon learns that someone might have been watching him all through the night.

The thriller feels slightly Hitchcockian, as it is paced well with a lot of twists and turns. The acting is very good, the editing is tight, and the film keeps you guessing until the end though I am afraid that not many mystery or suspense fans will find the conclusion as ingenious as the filmmakers think. In short, entertaining as it is, the film would leave most viewers with the impression that - well, what should I say - the characters' motives or decision-making processes are not very convincing.

"The Candidate" is like a skillfully-made puzzle. You may be fascinated with the process of solving it, but once you see the whole picture, there is not much that would impress you.
